Name: Final Girl: The Haunting of Creech Manor
Description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

In The Haunting of Creech Manor, when a family moves into infamous Creech Manor, their little girl Carolyn begins noticing supernatural phenomena. Produced by A.J. Porfirio, this Feature Film box has a killer of a different kind! Can the babysitter turned savior find Carolyn and get out before it's too late? Tyler Johnson reprises his role as Director of Photography in The Haunting of Creech Manor!

The 'Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

NOTE: The 2023 First Printing Correction Pack contained 3 corrected cards:

    TERROR - "It's coming, it's coming!"
    TERROR - "Carolyn? Where are you?"
    ITEM - "Carolyn"

Name: Nine Lives: Rogue-and-Write
Description:
Nine Lives is a Rogue-Like Roll-and-Write Game

You are a Cat trying to explore a Dungeon. You only have Nine Lives to explore the Dungeon. Find treasure, upgrade your Cat, and explore the dungeon in order to earn the most points.

Players: 1 - 100+
Game Time: 20 minutes
Items needed: 6 six-sided dice, one of them being a different color than the other five and one “Nine Lives” sheet per player

Setup: Roll 2 d6 to determine the End Goals for the game, mark the End Goals with an X over the die symbol. (Re-roll if necessary until there are two different numbers)
All players will use the same Dungeon Map layout and End Goals. The game is played simultaneously, with players trying to earn the most points. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, assigning however each player determines.

Gameplay:
Determine Starting Point - Roll 2 d6 that are different colors. Use the darker die for determining the columns and the lighter die for determining the rows. Find coordinating locations on the Dungeon Map. Choose one and mark an X on the Dungeon Map to show your starting point for this life. If a 6 is rolled on the die, it is a wild for that row or column, and you may choose any location while still following the other die rolled. If both dice are 6’s, you can start at any location on the map. Each player chooses their own starting point following these rules.

Choose a Cat - Choose a Cat by marking the number of this life in the corner for this run in the dungeon. For the first turn, use the Starter Cat. Following turns, you may choose any cat that has not yet been chosen. In a multiplayer game, each player can choose any Cat they would like for each life.

Roll 5 Dice - Roll 5 d6 for this Cat’s life in the dungeon.

Assign Dice - For each die, choose to either Upgrade a skill or Move the direction of the dice in the dungeon. Players simultaneously use the 5 dice rolled to move and/or upgrade.

Repeat these steps for each life of your Cat.

How Movement Works:
- Orthogonally (Up, Down, Right, Left; North, South, East, West) 
- When you enter a new square/room, mark an X on it.
- Your next movement must always follow from the last X you marked this life. 
- The die numbers correspond to the direction you may move; 1=North, 2=East, 3=South, 4=West, 5=North OR South, 6=East OR West
- You may only move into a square/room without an X. You may never retrace your steps or go onto a space that you have previously X’ed. 
- If you enter a square/room with an icon that you have upgraded to, you earn a treasure. Mark an X over one of the Treasure. Each Treasure is worth 2 Victory Points.
- You may X squares/rooms that have icons you have not unlocked yet, you just will not earn that Treasure this game.
- There are “Upgrade Arrows” throughout the map.   If you ever enter one of these spaces, you immediately mark the next X on any one Upgrade track

How Upgrading Works:
- There are four skill tracks to advance to upgrade your Cat throughout the game.
- Upgrade from left to right, marking an X in the leftmost empty square corresponding to the die.
- Once a square with an icon in it is X’ed, you now have that skill. When entering spaces in the Dungeon Map with that icon, you now earn Treasure.
- Once a skill track has been upgraded 9 times, you unlock a unique ability to use once during each Cat’s life. 
- Upgrades remain for the entire game.

End of Game: After you have used your last Cat (9 lives), the game is over. Total your score. Each Treasure earned is worth 2 Victory Points. Earn corresponding Victory Points for each Upgrade unlocked (On each skill track, first unlock is 1 VP, second unlock is an additional 2 VP, third unlock is an additional 3 VP). Total your Victory Points for the two End Goals that were rolled during Setup. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner!

-description from designer

Name: Final Girl: Carnage at the Carnival
Description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

Carnage at the Carnival - Geppetto wanted a family of his own. Using inspiration from his favorite stories and with the help of dark rituals, he decided to make his own. This circus is just a front to find more "new additions" to the family.

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

NOTE: The 2023 First Printing Correction Pack contained 3 corrected cards:

    TERROR - "Is this a prop?"
    TERROR - "How can there be so many traps?"
    EVENT - "Run! I'll hold them off!"

Name: Final Girl: Slaughter in the Groves
Description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

Each year, thousands of tourists flock to the "Ancient Groves" in Africa to see ancient and beautiful settings, artifacts, and places of worship. Vacations turn to nightmares when the masked killer, Inkanyamba, arrives to exact revenge on behalf of the gods. Slaughter in the Groves is produced by Evan Derrick with scenes by talented Director of Photography Tumo Mere.

The Core Box, when combined with one of our Feature Film Boxes, has everything you need to play the game. Each Feature Film Box features a unique Killer and and iconic Location, and the more Feature Films you have, the more killer/location combinations you can experience!

Each Feature Film Box is double-sided, with amazingly illustrated covers on the front AND back. Not only that, but the magnetically attached box covers are removable, with the reverse of each functioning as the Killer and Location boards respectively.

NOTE: The 2023 First Printing Correction Pack contained 1 corrected card:

    EVENT - "Tour Guide"

Name: きゃらおこし (Kyaraokoshi)
Description:
In ãã‚ƒã‚‰ãŠã“ã— (Ki Raokoshi), the players are designing mascots for a fictional city by adding three characteristics of the city to a template.  Mechanically, the game includes several dry erase cards with outlines of various potential mascot shapes, and a series of cards with three choices of traits for the city (e.g. it is known for its shipping industry).

The start player chooses 1 of 4 types of cards, and one of the traits on it for all players to represent on their mascot cards.  Once all the players are finished drawing, the next player chooses a card.  The process repeats for a third card as well.  Once everyone has named their drawing, the players discuss and vote on which would be best to represent the town.  Points are earned, and the player with the most points after 3 rounds wins.

Name: Blobbiemundo: Despertar de las Gárgolas – Volumen I
Description:
Introduces 8 new Limestone Statue shapes.
In their natural state, these statues are Objects with a Defense of 20 points in all 3 environments, but no other abilities.
These statues have Apotropaic powers of transformation into Gargoyles: flying mammals with many abilities.

Name: Les Gens Braves: Rules for Wargaming the Franco-Prussian War
Description:
Les Gens Braves are Miniature Wargame Rules for the Franco-Prussian War in 15 or 25mm.

The rules cover weather, command and control, movement, charge, French counter-attacks, firing, Chassepot & mitrailleuses, melee, morale, disorganisation...

Comes with background, information and tactics on both armies.

—user summary

Name: Pizza Wars
Description:
A game of conquest played on a pizza where the toppings represent combatants and the pieces represent territories to be conquered.

—user summary

A game of conquest and supremacy, for gamers and Pizza lovers alike.

Includes all rules necessary for conducting your very own PIZZA WAR. Requires a Pizza, toppings, toothpicks and one or more dice to play.

No longer must you break from your game to enjoy Americas' (sic) favorite food!

The manufacturers, distributors and retailers of PIZZA WARS are not responsible for adverse effects due to over-zealous conquest. Conquer at your own risk!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Liberty or Death: American Revolutionary Rules
Description:
Miniature Wargame Rules for the American War of Independence.

36 page book.

Name: The Long Endure: American Civil Wargaming
Description:
Miniature Wargame rules for simulating the American Civil War.

43 page book + 4 page card playsheet.

Name: Chain Mail: Welcome to Darkhill – Adventure Kit
Description:
The heir of Darkhill has been falsely imprisoned. The royal family has charged you with seeing to the heir's rescue but warn you that the prison is hidden.

Suit up and set out to find the prison, break in, get to the heir, and get out alive.

Welcome to Darkhill is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Rescue the heir from a hidden prison.

This expansion includes:

     Quest: The Heir of Darkhill
     Map: The Crypt of Zafinn
     Monsters: Firebeast / Snapwort
     Treasure: Enchanted Hourglass



Released in the November 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
Families: Game: Chain Mail – Adventures of Earthshine

Name: Tempus Quest: Episode 11 – Frying Pan / Fire
Description:
By the skin of their teeth, the Tempus leaves the Dynasty Armada behind them. The only obstacle in their way now is... an even larger armada. Now trapped between an overwhelming number of foes, the rag tag Liberation Fleet has no choice but to fight their way to the Liberation's rendezvous point.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer

Name: Cloudspire: Hero's Bounty Pack
Description:
Hero's Bounty is a pack containing 34 cards (Events and Relics) and a tuckbox (every Stretch Goal unlocked from the second Kickstarter Campaign).

This is not a Kickstarter exclusive and this pack will be available for purchase.

Name: Cloudspire: Ankar's Plunder – Bonus Scenarios & Skirmishes
Description:
Ankar's Plunder hardcover lore and art book complete the first (The Joining War) by telling more about the arrival of the two new factions in the game (The Uprising and Horizon's Wrath).

Features new extended novella, new high-res art from the Ankar's Plunder campaign, and new solo/co-op scenarios and skirmish battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Blaubeuren
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: YANASI
Description:
BACKGROUND
Players incarnate Cherokee tribefolk trying to setup their own buffalo herd  (Buffalo is "Yanasi" in the Cherokee language).

OBJECTIVE
Ideally, capture a family of buffaloes else, capture as many buffaloes as possible.

COMPONENT
50 tiles (including 5 Path tiles), 1 Snake token, and 1 Cherokee pawn/meeple/cube (not provided).

END OF THE GAME
A player wins if he or she has 3 identical Buffalo tiles.

Else, game immediately ends if the draw pile is empty. In that case, the player with more Buffaloes illustrated on his or her tiles is the winner.

In case of a tie, the second player wins as the Snake bites the first player!

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Assassin's Creed Syndicate
Description:
The universe of Assassin's Creed puts the fan in the middle of an ancient struggle between two factions - The Assassins, who fight to protect mankind's right to freedom, and the Templars, who wish to impose a New World Order. Join the Brotherhood in Assassin's Creed Monopoly and revisit the most iconic locations of the series with breathtaking concept art. Past and present collide as you walk in the footsteps of the Assassins Altair, Ezio, Aveline, Connor, Edward, using the special Assassins playing pieces. Show off your Assassin's Creed Monopoly parkour skills and invest, negotiate, and trade your way to victory. What type of strategy will you choose? Should you try to collect as much as you can, or focus on specific targets?

—description from the publisher

Name: Game of Triads or Chords
Description:
This card game from 1898 by music publisher Theodore Presser was intended to be an educational aid to music students.

The deck consists of 39 cards, which together form the basic chords possible for each of the 13 keys. Each card has a large letter in the middle, representing its note. The key to which that note belongs is in the upper right corner, and the musical symbol for that key (sharps or flats) is in the upper left. The bottom of the card lists all three notes in that key.

The rules say that the game can be played as a simple set collection game like Authors, but is more interesting with a second set of rules, which it says resemble "Cassino".

Each player is dealt a hand of five cards, and five more are dealt face up on the table. In turn, each player must if possible place a card from hand onto the table that matches the key of one of those showing. If unable to place a matching card, he may place any other card on the table. The player who puts the final card in a triad or chord collects all three as a set.

If no cards remain on the table, the next player puts down any card to start the process over. When any player runs out of cards, one more card is dealt to each player. Once all cards have been played, the player collecting the largest number of sets wins.

—user summary

Name: Maggi's Fliegerspiel
Description:
This is a colorful roll-and-move game published during the 1930s by Swiss food company Maggi that specialized in bouillon cubes and sauces. Players start from Maggi's pre-WWII factory in Kempttal, and fly an open cockpit, single-seat plane across Europe, around Africa, over to Australia and then home via India, the Middle East and Russia.

The illustrations are highly racist by today's standards. The Maggi representative is shown receiving a nose ring in return for offering Maggi soup to a pair of natives southern Africa, escaping from a dagger-wielding Arab by making soup with a bouillon cube, and being tied to a tree by Australian Aborigines while they feast on his Maggi cargo.

—user summary

Name: Hyakuninisshu English Translated Karuta 51-100: Part 2
Description:
Finally you can play like Chihayafuru!

This English Hyakuninisshu Karuta (poetry card game) uses the original Japanese poems from Ogura Hyakuninisshu translated to English "wakas" (5+7+5; 7+7 syllables). This karuta includes card no. 51-100 (Part 2).

All cards have both the Japanese original poem with a unique illustration or text, from the original karuta from Shogundo plus the English translation (by Clay MacCauley 1917) on the back of the cards.

Review from Japan Center Michigan State University 2020-03-09
“…really appreciated how you used the 5-7-5-7-7 syllable translations, and the reading app made it feel just as real to them as the “traditional” version of the game.”

Tip: Download the free iOS audio reader app (companion app for this game). You can use the reader app for practicing and also when you are only two persons and you need a reader. We have two reader apps. 1. Hyakuninisshu EN : This reader app sings the poems exactly like the Japanese wakas (original poems)which are sung since 400 years. 2. Read Hyakunin Isshu EN: This reader app is read normally. It is easier to understand when it is read normally but the app which is sung sounds more genuine like the original Japanese karuta.

Name: Ogoola Karuta:  51-100 English Modern
Description:
The Ogoola Karuta Poetry Game ENGLISH MODERN (cards 51-100)

Play like Chihayafuru with poems written in English!

This edition uses 50 modern English poems from the 19th century until today. Some of the poets included are Tennyson, Whitman, Yeats, Joyce, Plath, Pound, Frost, Eliot, Heaney and Merwin. Contains 50 reading cards, 50 playing cards and a poetry book (instructions, rules, history and the 100 poetry quotes both classic and modern).

Karuta is a game about listening and finding FAST what you are listening to in the cards you will pick. Grab the correct cards FAST before the others do in order to win! Known as an intellectual martial arts game in Japan. The cards have famous poetry quotes on them but no prior knowledge is needed!

This edition is not a translation of the original Japanese Hyakuninisshu poems. However,the original Japanese cards from Shogundo are printed on the backside as a design so you can play the game in Japanese if you can read and understand it.

Tip: Download the reader app available on Google Play and the App Store.
Enjoy to the reader Myrra Malmberg. This app serves as the reader when you want to practice or when everybody wants to play. Especially if you are only two persons, this app will allow both persons to play the game. The iOS app is free.

iOS app: Ogoola Karuta EN 100
Android: Karuta English Ogoola

Name: Fingerlings Jungle Gym Jumble
Description:
Gameplay is reminiscent of both Jenga and Mousetrap, but with substantially simpler structures and shorter playing time.

The game comes with four Fingerlings.  Three of them can be seen through the packaging.  The fourth is a 'mystery monkey' that remains hidden until you open the game.

Players take turn rolling dice and moving their Fingerlings around the board.  When she lands on a "build" space, a player adds a piece to her "jungle gym" structure.

Once the player's jungle gym is complete, she attempts to hang from the highest bar on the jungle gym without making it collapse.  The winner is the first player who successfully hangs her fingerling on the jungle gym twice.

Name: Hyakuninisshu English Translated Karuta 1-100 Complete
Description:
Hyakuninisshu English Translated Karuta is an English translated version of the Japanese Karuta using the translation of the original Japanese old poems from the anthology called "Hyakuninisshu". This edition is the complete version of all 100 cards.

The game is sometimes described as intellectual martial arts. It is about listening and being extremely focused and fast, just like the Samurai with their swords. Only here you fight with cards instead. The manga and anime and now a movie called "Chihayafuru" is about this game. For Chihayafuru fans, this is the karuta you've been waiting for!

The game is comprised of two decks of cards, the Reader deck and the Player deck. Cards in the Reader deck contain the whole poems while cards in the Player deck contain only the second part of these poems. To begin the game, a Reader is chosen (or you may opt to use the Reader app) and the players are divided into two teams sitting on opposite sides of the table or play area. The Reader shuffles the Reader deck and the Players mix, split evenly the Player deck between the teams and place them face-up in 3-4 rows in front of them. The Reader will read the complete poem on the reading cards and the player that finds the matching Playing card first takes that card and puts it aside. If the card taken was on your opponent's side, you must give one card from your side to your opponent. The first team that has no cards left on their side is the winner (you must get rid of all your cards first, to win).

The game is set in Japan during the Genpei war (1180-1185). In order to win the war, you need a strategy. Place the cards you are familiar with close to you (in the beginning it is normal that none of the cards are familiar). If you know what cards your opponent is familiar with, place those cards as far as possible from them inside the playing field. Since the reader or app will always read the complete quotation, you do not need prior knowledge of the poems. Strategically place the playing cards in a way that you can find and take them quickly such as laying them alphabetically or categorize them under the same first words.

Name: Limbo Road
Description:
It has been written that “The road to hell is paved with good intentions.” However, that road to hell (or heaven) first leads to limbo. In this game you and a friend are full of good intentions, and abstractly perform good deeds – both big and small – throughout your lives. Some turn out poorly, however, so you will have to travel the limbo road. At the end of the journey, only one of you can win the game and move on.

Both players will use cards to move along Limbo Road, along with a few special cards to help their cause or hinder their opponent. They'll collect colored Good Deed tiles which may provide victory points, and Fate tiles which will provide special actions. Upon reaching limbo the game becomes a bit restricted and players will have to choose their actions more carefully.... This is an easy-playing game with some interesting decisions and, hopefully, decent levels of excitement and fun.

—description from the designer

Name: Bag of Spiders
Description:
It's a bag of spiders! it's also 8 fun and fantastic games to play with 1-9 of your friends and enemies!

Bag of Spiders features eight  silly games that we have curated for your enjoyment, but you will find that there are many uses for your bag of spiders.

Bag of Spiders, a press your luck game for 2 - 5 players by Jeremy Davis
 Last Spider Standing, a rolling war game for 2 - 4 players by Jeremy Davis
 Squish, a social awkwardness game for 5 - 10 players by Carla Kopp and Jeremy Davis
 Spider Leap, a dexterity game for 2 - 4 players by Jeremy Davis and Shawn Stankewich
 Spider Sculptors, an artistic game for 4 - 8 players by Shawn Stankewich, Nick Kopp, and Jeremy Davis
 Spider Poker, a bluffing game for 3 - 5 players by Zach Hoekstra
 Spider-cala, an abstract game for 2 players by Zach Hoekstra
 Mississippi Jackson And The Curse Of The Squeaky Inflatable Spiders, a very silly RPG for 2-6 players by Zach Hoekstra

Name: Snits!
Description:
Snits! is a compilation of Tom Wham's two Snits games: Snit Smashing and Snit's Revenge. Both games have been developed by Steve Jackson and so have some changes from earlier versions:


     Snit Smashing has extensive changes, including a different board size, fixed movement rates for Snits, no written Snit orders, six rounds to a set (game phase) instead of nine, etc.



     Snit's Revenge has an altered Bolotomus turn order, a change to how Snorgs (organs) are replaced, standard Snit abilities instead of optional (and they are different), and a few other changes.

Name: Tucson-Opoly
Description:
Buy Tucson properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rally 7
Description: Use your dice rolls to get your pegs across the board and home first while scoring points. Get the most points and win the game!

Name: Larvapocalypse: Series 1 Expansion
Description:
Larvapocalypse: Series 1 Expansion contains an additional 25 Larvapocalypse figures to the game.

Series 1 figures were released in booster packs of 5 and 10, the 5 pack containing an additional board piece.

Name: Modern Equipment Handbook: Part One – Equipment specifications and point values for Challenger 2000 rules
Description:
'Modern Equipment Handbook Part One: Equipment specifications and point values for Challenger 2000 rules

Covers Tanks, Tank Destroyers, Infantry & Fire Support Vehicles, Reconnaissance Vehicles, and Anti-Tank Guided Weapons

- user description

Name: Modern Equipment Handbook: Part Two – Equipment specifications for Artillery, Rocket Launchers, Mortars, and Infantry Weapons for Challenger 2000 rules
Description:
'Modern Equipment Handbook: Part Two - Equipment specifications for Artillery, Rocket Launchers, Mortars, and Infantry Weapons for Challenger 2000 rules

Contain details on: Arty, Mortars, AA Guns, SAMs, Helicopters, etc.

The equipment specifications are listed by country in alphabetical order.

- user description

Name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Mobile Infantry Army Book
Description:
The greatest army in the history of mankind, the Mobile Infantry is the place for dedicated men and women who are ready to put themselves in harm’s way for the safety of the body politic. Equipped with the best weaponry that Earth can provide, there are few enemies that can resist them for long.

The United Citizens’ Federation is in need of such soldiers. Enemies press in on all sides, terrible alien races who seek to dominate the universe and wipe humanity from the galactic map. The Arachnids are but on threat that has reared its head as they sweep through system after system. The Skinnies have also begun to muster their forces and there are rumors of yet more dreadful forces lurking at the edge of known space.

Humanity needs you! Are you doing your part?

The Mobile Infantry Army Book contains everything you need to construct a force of troopers capable of defending your world against any aggressor. From power suit platoons to the mighty Marauders, from the latest in Neodog engineering to the amazing TAC UAV, we provide the tools. You just have to supply the talent.

Mobile Infantry, Ho!

Name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Pathfinders Army Book
Description:
The best trained troopers within the Mobile Infantry, it is the role of the Pathfinders to accept and complete the most hazardous missions in the war zone. Equipped with the advanced M-1A6 power suit and taught to take the fight to the Arachnids, Pathfinder platoons can be found in every campaign.

With squads having easy access to specialists and advanced weaponry, the Pathfinders represent the pinnacle of the Mobile Infantry, the elite. Often fighting far behind enemy lines, Pathfinder platoons may even enter Arachnid tunnel networks in an effort to exterminate the aliens from the galaxy.

All troopers of the Mobile Infantry have the respect and gratitude of the civilians and citizens of the Federation. Despite the destruction of Buenos Aires that marked the true beginning of the Arachnid War, Earth remains a peaceful and prosperous place and its inhabitants know they have the Mobile Infantry and Mighty Fleet to thank for that. On colony worlds where clashes with the Arachnids come with alarming regularity, support for the military forces of the Federation tends to be much stronger.

The Pathfinders are a cut above the average trooper, even though few civilians or citizens are aware of their existence. They are the troopers that other troopers respect, the highly trained elite. It is the Pathfinders that reconnoiter important strategic positions behind the Arachnid line. They are the troopers tasked with extracting squads cut off by swarms of warrior bugs or entering bug holes to assassinate a potent brain bug. They are granted the best equipment and training the Federation can provide but in return are expected to complete missions that other forces within the Mobile Infantry would deem suicidal.

Contains:

     Army List: A complete army list for Pathfinder platoons, including special rules unique to this elite force.
     Painting Guide: Full color pages jam-packed with examples of Pathfinder armies and different paint schemes.
     New Equipment: Complete rules for the new equipment available only to Pathfinder platoons.

Name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Skinnies Army Book
Description:
The Skinnies have raided the borders of the federation for years but the Mobile Infantry has concentrated its military might on the far more dangerous Arachnids. 
Now, the Skinnies have declared outright war on humanity and no amount of diplomacy or politicking seems likely to stop them.

The Skinnies Army Book reveals this mysterious race:

     their culture,
     their technology
     and their motives

Name: Ten in a Bed
Description:
Spin a +1, +2 or +3 to collect 1, 2 or 3 toys. Land on -1 and it's "ten in a bed and the little one said roll over so they all rolled over and one fell out" and a toy is lost.  A fun counting game with an introduction to adding and subtracting.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ankh: Gods of Egypt – Pantheon
Description:
The war of the gods did not begin with any formal declaration. No sides were drawn, no single event cascaded into open battle. Instead, it was the slow realization that as devotion to one god waxed, power to the others waned.

Some thought themselves above the fray, thought themselves wiser, learned, or immune to the whim of mortal man. They were wrong. The gods do not exist without followers, and devotion is their lifeblood, whether they wish it so or not. The tide of cosmic balance had shifted towards mankind, and the gods who once enjoyed their unquestioning deference now have to contend for prominence.

Thus it was that the last holdouts who sought to distance themselves from the fray took to the battlefield in their own bids for dominance. What had begun as jostling in a minor power struggle had drawn in all the mightiest deities across the Egyptian pantheon.

In the end, there could be only one.

The Pantheon expansion introduces a whole new set of five Egyptian gods, each bringing their own abilities and warriors to the fight against oblivion. The introduction of each new god into the game not only gives new options to the player who controls them, but also changes the landscape for everyone on the table. New strategies and dynamics arise as different mixes of gods are pitted against each other, and the Pantheon expansion increases these combinations exponentially!

The Pantheon expansion comes with:

5 God figures and 30 Warrior figures:
       -  1 Horus God figure and 6 Horus Warrior figures
       -  1 Hathor God figure and 6 Hathor Warrior figures
       -  1 Set God figure and 6 Set Warrior figures
       -  1 Thoth God figure and 6 Thoth Warrior figures
       -  1 Bastet God figure and 6 Bastet Warrior figures
5 God dashboards
5 Joined God dashboards
30 Battle cards (6 for each God)
20 Color bases (4 for each God)
80 Ankh tokens (16 for each God)

Additionally, acquired in the Kickstarter campaign, you also get 5 Kickstarter Exclusive bonus plastic components: 3 sculpted Bastet Cat tokens and 2 engraved Eye of Horus tokens.

Name: PAPER ROLL & Write
Description:
"Grandpa, can you tell again the story of when all the toilet paper in the world disappeared?" The old man's face closed, stripped of his usual smile. And, as he pulled the children into his lap, all those memories kept within him, closed by the invisible key of the passage of time, began to flow. His voice sounded calm and painful. “In that strange period of our lives, there were a number of people who, without reason, decided to use up all the toilet paper in the world. These people were part of a radical terrorist movement called P.O.O.H., which basically meant the Party of the Organized and Obsessive Hoarders.”

PAPER ROLL & Write is a roll & write game, for 2 players. One of the players takes command of the Party of the Organized and Obsessive Hoarders (hereinafter referred to as P.O.O.H.), whose aim is to try to deplete the toilet paper stock in the stores, leading the population to total panic. The other player assumes the role of Coordinator of a group of specialists called by the government to resolve this crisis, ensuring the production and supply of paper to the city.

In each round, the P.O.O.H rolls a certain number of dice. Then, the Coordinator chooses how many dice will be used during that round by BOTH players. For each dice that he decides not to use during that round, panic increases by 1.  The more dice the Coordinator choses, the more dice he and the P.O.O.H. will use. The more dice he choses not to use, the more the panic increases.
The Coordinator will use dice to produce and distribute paper across stores, while P.O.O.H will use the same dice to accumulate bonuses in his headquarters and to visit stores on the map, buying all the paper and spread the panic, while avoiding being slowed down by the police.

The Coordinator wins the game if at least 5 stores are supplied with paper. 
The P.O.O.H. wins the game if the panic reaches the end of the panic track.

In the end of each round, players exchange the game sheets they have in their possession. This creates a constant back and forth between players, because the sheet that one player is currently using, will be used by the other player in the next round.

Also, the Coordinator and the POOH play two completely different types of games, which highly increases replayability.

“PAPER ROLL & write is a free Print & Play Roll & Write board game for two players. But for us it is more than a game, it is a cheerful and positive manifesto in times of uncertainty, and a joint effort from 3 designers in Lockdown due to Covid-19.

—description from the publisher

Name: Song of Tales
Description:
Song of Tales is a game of collaborative and competitive story telling for 1-8 players.  Players select a character from world folk tales to play as and then lay out a series of story fragments. They have to tell a story to tie the fragments together into a single coherent whole, using the style of their chosen character to do so. Other players can bid to join in with the story-teller's tale, extending the story and earning points for both teller and listener.

Each story is scored, and at the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer

Name: The Fall of the King
Description:
Ventura Battle System is a historical wargame for 2 players aged 9 and up, accessible even to beginners. In fact, it is surprisingly simple, having very few rules to learn while still offering players incredible tactical depth. Ventura Battle System is an original editorial work produced by Sir Chester Cobblepot Wargames, developed by eNigma and published by Top Hat Games.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars of the Guelphs and Ghibellines
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: RUSE
Description: Raise your pack of kits more efficiently than other players. Ensure their growth and accelerate your game by developing their instincts in your den. RUSE Instincts of the Den invites you on an exhilarating adventure in a Fox-themed Mid-Weight Euro-style strategy game. Unique design with worker placement, territories exploration, resource and dice management. The player who accumulates the most victory points wins the game.

Name: Fingerlings Ruckus Card Game
Description:
This is a simplified reskin of Ruckus (similar to the L.O.L. Surprise version). Players collect cards with pictures of Fingerlings (brightly colored monkey characters) by stealing from other players to form sets. There are 72 cards (6 cards for each of 12 characters).

The endgame rules differ slightly from traditional Ruckus. Instead of shouting "OUT!" as in traditional Ruckus, players shout "FINGERLINGS!"

The game comes with a toy Fingerling that is not used in the game.  Different boxes will have different colors of Fingerlings (visible through the packaging).

Name: Orléans: Estátua
Description:
Estátua (Statue) is a level I promo Place Tile for Orléans.
You may place every new Follower gained in Phase 5 into your Market instead of your bag.

This was included as a part of OrlÃ©ans: Promo Ortskarten NÂ°2.

Name: Fast Flip Pizza
Description: Fast paced card game where you race to find the match between the symbols printed on the fronts and backs of cards.

Name: Broken Crown
Description:
Broken Crown is an epic Kingdom Building strategy game for 2-5 players set in the world of Orvæn; a land rich with history and culture that still aches from the scars of recent war. Players act as a noble of their unique homeland to rebuild their nation’s glory and restore the Crown.

Each play of Broken Crown is different from the next. The game uses elements of Euro-Style trading games along with direct player conflict to create a dynamic, ever-changing experience. Players win the game by achieving the most Glory points at the game’s end. Each game is played over a number of Years, each year being split in to 3 turns referred to as Seasons. As the seasons pass, event cards will be revealed that will affect all nations, and players will have to adapt in order to maintain their place in the Kingdom. 
During the Market Phase players may recruit famed Champions, each with their own story and deep interwoven family history. They may purchase land deeds and ancient relics by bidding in the central Marketplace. These cards may be placed on their Realm Boards to build their own unique economies and armies.

In the Battle Phase, each player will secretly choose from their battle cards to maintain peace, attack another player’s realm or assist others in their efforts.

How well players fare in Orvæn depends not just on their economic or military skill, but their ability to negotiate and lead. Broken Crown allows for free trade and deal making between players for resources and assistance. Some players will choose to become warlords, seeking to dominate others in their pursuit of glory. Some will be peacekeepers of the land, earning their title as a respected leader of the people.

Build your Realm • Unite the Nations • Mend The Crown

—description from the designer

Name: Nailed It
Description:
Nailed It is an adult party game where players get to celebrate relatable stereotypes we see in our everyday lives. Players will each be given 6 category cards to start the game. On these each card, there are items from 4 categories: location, food, clothing, and ailment.

Players will be challenged to create a story about why a category item (location, food, clothing, or ailment) in their hand is the best fit for the selected Stereotype. Stories can be simple or complex, logical or far-fetched. It’s up to the judge to decide!

Once a judge picks their favorite story and awards the player the Nailed It that stereotype card.

However – be aware that there are several Drop the Hammer cards players might have. If a player “drops the hammer,” the judge must pick a different winner for that round.

The role of judge goes around the table. For 6+ players, the first player to earn three stereotype cards wins the game. For 5 or less players, 5 stereotype cards wins.

Name: Word Slap
Description:
In Word Slap, players compete in a quick, play-anywhere word game of strategy and speed. Players contribute nouns to a collective pool and take turns giving clues as to a noun they chose. However, being silly and strange in clue-giving is a must, because the clue-giver gets points for each person who doesn't choose their clue. However, if nobody chooses their clue, they get nothing! If you are not the clue-giver, move fast; the first person to get the noun right also gets a point. Remove that noun and then change the clue-giver. Who will have the most points after a few rounds?

Word Slap is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

—description from the designer

Name: The Little Prince: Story Board Adventure
Description:
NOTE: Physical Game Coming Soon
Additional Note: The Original PnP is a prototype of the new game coming out. If you have it, please do not distribute it.

You are on an adventure to trace The Little Prince’s journey through space. You come across different destinations such as planets with strange inhabitants, beautiful creatures, and dangerous baobabs!

Players will travel to different destinations on the game board trying to obtain cards corresponding to those destinations on the game board. A Destination is a place on the board where the illustration from the book “The Little Prince” is present and where a player may land. Specific actions are carried out when a player lands on these places.

The places where a player may land between each destination are the gray and red star spaces. When a player lands on these spaces, different actions may be carried out, such as drawing cards from the decks and exchanging cards from the discard pile. The first player to have three of the same destination cards, revealing it, and passing/landing on the destination that corresponds to the cards wins the game.

So, if a Player collects three “Asteroid B-612" cards, they must reveal it from their "secret" hand and then proceed to pass/land on the destination “Asteroid B-612” to win the game.

Name: Great War
Description:
Great War: The World War One Miniatures game

1918 saw great changes in the warfare of the Western Front. Russia pulled out of the war, freeing thousands more German troops to push the Allies back huge distances. The Allied counteroffensives, with their new tanks and evolving tactics, forced the Germans back towards their own borders and defeat. The Great War book contains all the rules, army lists and missions to play the game, along with a comprehensive catalogue to help you plan your army

Content:

     History of the last battles of the Great War, including the Battle of Villers-Bretonneux, Battle of Soissons, and the Meuse Argonne Offensive.
     Great War rules for fighting the battles of 1918.
     Options to field German Infanterie, Stoss, Jäger, or Siegfriedstellung companies with supporting A7V panzers in the great offensives of 1918.
     Field a British Line or Elite Rifle Company, ANZAC or Canadian Rifle Company, or a Cavalry Squadron and stop the German offensives, or go on the attack supported by the Army's great new war machines: Mark IV, Mark V, and Whippet tanks.
     Field a French Metropolitan Compagnie de Fusiliers, Colonial Compagnie de Tirailleurs, Escadron de Cavalerie or Foreign Russian and American companies as they drive the Germans from France with the aid of their Schneider CA.1 and Char Saint Chamond heavy tanks, as well as the nimble FT-17 light tank.
     Field an American trained, veteran, or Marine Rifle Company with French tanks, British tanks, or your own American FT-17 tanks in support.
     Field a Belgian Compagnie de Infanterie supported by artillery and their French and British allies.
     Great War missions and mission rules.
     Inspirational painting guides and color photos.


—description from the publisher

Name: Cross 6
Description:
There are lines with numbers in white spaces.

At the end of each line, there is a number in a grey space.

For each line, the sum the numbers in white spaces must be equal to the grey number.

To win, you will have to cross exactly 6 white spaces. Each crossed white space won’t count for the grey numbers value.

Take a pen and a timer (10 minutes for a 1-player game, 5 for a 2-player game). When you are ready to start, launch the timer.

If you finish the game before the end of the timer, you win. If you have lost, look to one of the solutions.

—description from the designer

Name: RYCE: Roll You Can Eat
Description:
In RYCE – Roll You Can Eat you will feel the heat and rush of a restaurant kitchen, as you get ingredients, prepare recipes and serve them. You must always keep an eye open on other players and try to hinder them, as they will return the favor if given the chance. Only the best player will become sushi master.

RYCE is a roll & write game which uses customized 6-sided and 8-sided dice with typical ingredients on each face. You will prepare different kinds of maki, fry shrimps to make tempura and boil a lot of rice to make the good old salmon nigiri.

Each turn the active player rolls all dice and takes two ingredients to prepare recipes. But everybody else also takes one of the leftover ingredients because everybody acts in each turn, there is no time to rest in the kitchen. With the taken ingredients you cover steps on a recipe and, once every step is done, you deliver the dish to a table. Finishing a recipe grants victory points and you become more skilled with it: next time you finish that recipe, it will be worth more! Meanwhile a race is on to finish serving each table and get the juicy bonus victory points for being the first to do so.

RYCE is a fast-paced 1-4 game, with simultaneous actions and randomized setup. Included in the rulebook there is a variant for the 1 vs 1 game and rules for solo play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Invazions: Philibert
Description:
Philibert is a real board game store in Strasbourg, France.

One more place for the Invazions game.

This place can replace one of the places in the base game. It has a defense of 5, and the following effects:

     Humans: as long as there is a search on the place, your card hand is increased by 1
     Zombies: +1 zombie

Name: Quarantine Haircuts
Description:
Quarantine Haircuts is a push-your-luck, roll-and-write game where you try to give the best haircuts to your entire family

Overview:
Unable to leave your home during quarantine, your family is in desperate need of some haircuts. Cut their hair, but make sure not to cut off too much hair, or else you will have to buzz off all their hair.

Players: 1 - 100+
Game Time: 10 minutes
Items needed: 3 six-sided dice

Gameplay:
Roll - Roll all 3 dice. Set aside all, some, or none. Re-roll any dice. You can re-roll the dice up to two times, and may stop rolling at any time. 
Write - Mark off the results of all 3 dice rolled for this haircut. (You may only mark off results for the current haircut)
Buzz Cut? - Check if you have cut too much and reached the end of a number track, hitting an X. If so, score 0 and go to next haircut.
Keep Cutting or Stop - Choose to keep cutting and repeating these steps or to stop. If you stop, score the number directly below your last mark on each track. Then, go to the next haircut.

End of Game:
After you have completed the last haircut decision (in F), total up your score from all your haircuts. Congratulations, you have completed your Quarantine Haircuts!

Name: Heist: The Game of Chaos
Description:
Heist is a fast-paced, collaborative party game that pits two teams of crooks against each other in a bank robbery gone mad. Gameplay is fueled by chaos and player interaction. There are no turns, just non-stop action.

Two crews will race to resolve tasks, remove targets and complete challenging mini-games by using tool cards and performing absurd actions. To win you'll need to stay on your toes and keep an eye out for your teammates. Who knows what will happen…? Why are those thugs after Gayle? Who turned off the lights? Where did this drink come from? Why’s Tommy sleepin’ on the job?

Win or lose, Heist is a blast to play — the bee's knees if you will. So roll up your sleeves, pour yourself a stiff one and get ready for the Heist of the century.

—description from the designer

Name: Blood & Guts: U.S. Army Guide for Disposable Heroes II
Description:
Blood & Guts is the U.S. Army Supplement for Disposable Heroes II

This book contains all the platoon lists for the U.S. Army. It also contains the weapons, vehicles, and support weapons used by the U.S. Army in WWII.

The three scenarios allow players to put their U.S. forces up against the Germans in two theaters (Italy and Normandy) covering three different types of tactical challenges (Defense, Attack, and Airborne Drop).

A short history and timeline of the U.S. involvement in WWII and some ends notes on how to use the book gives players the complete Disposable Heroes II supplement they need to play the U.S. Army in WWII.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Disposable Heroes Miniature Rules (Iron Ivan Games)

Name: Angriff! German Army Book for Disposable Heroes II
Description:
Angriff, the German Army Book, has been updated and expanded (128 pages) to be used with the Disposable Heroes II Wargaming Rules by the author Keith Stine.

The book contains all the platoon lists for the Wehrmacht (including Heer, SS, and Luftwaffe ground units.) It also contains the weapons, vehicles and support weapons used by the German Army in WWII.

The three scenarios allow players to put their German forces up against their enemies in three theaters (France 1940, Soviet Union 1943, and Holland 1944), covering three types of tactical challenges (Defense, Attack and Armored Infantry Assault.)

A short history and the timeline of the German Army in WWII and some end notes on how to use the book gives players the complete Disposable Heroes II supplement they need to play the German Army in WWII.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Disposable Heroes Miniature Rules (Iron Ivan Games)

Name: Box of Cards
Description:
Box of cards is a game that pits several political roles into a battle for prestige and coin. In Box of Cards each player has a role with a distinct power, that gives the player advantage when certain colored cards are given. Each card play allows to win or take coins or prestige from other player, in an attempt to avoid letting them get ahead on the race.

In a game round, the player can choose between playing a card, by paying coins, or getting coins (the same cards but used  by their reverse side). Each card played has a special ability and an effect on one of the roles in play. The first player to get to 12 prestige points is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hackers \' Epoch
Description:
Hackers \’ Epoch Cybersecurity Card Game is a tool for teaching students many of the terms associated with threats and vulnerabilities within the scope of Cybersecurity. It is a STEM.org Authenticated Educational Product.

These cards gamify some aspects of cybersecurity training and provide the educator with a
starting point for the discussion of cybersecurity principles with students.

As students play the game, they use the cards to build their own network infrastructure
and defend it, while attempting to Deceive, Disrupt, Deny, Degrade, or Destroy systems and services belonging to other players. The goal is to add as many systems as possible to one’s own infrastructure before the game ends.

—description from the designer

Name: Fields of Battle: Berlin – Race to the Reichstag
Description:
This is the 3rd installment in the scenario campaign series Fields of Battle. 
Berlin Race to the Reichstag includes 16 platoon level/small unit skirmish scenarios, campaign decisions, a bonus multi-player "big battle" scenario, and a short tutorial on terrain, all centered in 1945 and the defense of Berlin. 
Disposable Heroes is needed for referenced information in this Scenario Book.

On April 22, 1945 General Helmuth Weidling received a direct telephone call from the Fu¨hrerbunker in Berlin. For disobeying Hitler’s express order not to withdraw the LVI Panzer Corps in the face of certain annihilation, Weidling was told over the telephone that he had been condemned to death by firing squad. Instead of attempting to avoid his execution by escape or suicide, Weidling drove to Berlin and walked into the Fu¨hrerbunker. Adolf Hitler, so impressed by his general’s courage, not only canceled the firing squad—he ordered 53-year old Helmuth Weidling to take command of Berlin’s defenses.2 “You might just as well have me shot,” Weidling remarked dryly to a staff orderly. As Berlin’s newest commandant—the previous three had each been sacked by Hitler—Weidling faced insurmountable challenges. He lacked manpower and even the most basic supplies, such as food and small arms ammunition. Berlin also lacked proper defensive fortifications and to complicate the situation further, Hitler’s adamant refusal to evacuate non-combatants meant that key military bastions—like the impregnable Zoo flak tower—were clogged with thousands of panicked civilians. But Weidling’s greatest challenge loomed farther east. The Red Army.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hokori
Description:
Hokori (meaning pride or arrogance), is an easy to learn 2 player bidding and dueling game to the death.  Players will first draw up a hand of 10 cards, choose which 5 to keep and which five to place up for bid.  Both players will bid on the remaining 10 cards, trying to choose wisely to gain an advantage over their opponent.  Once the bidding is over, the dueling phase begins.  Player choose their stance from 4 options (attack, defense, meditate, or instinct) each with their own advantages and disadvantages.  Play continues until both players have passed, are out of playable cards, or one player is dead.

—description from the designer

Name: Fields of Battle: Without Fortune – Arnhem 1944
Description:
Fields of Battle: Without Fortune, Arnhem 1944 is a WW2 Scenario Book for DHCSB

This is the 2nd installment in the scenario campaign series Fields of Battle. Without Fortune includes 20 platoon level/small unit skirmish scenarios, all centered in 1944 Arnhem and the British Paras. 
Disposable Heroes is needed for referenced information in this Scenario Book.

Operation Market Garden devised by British Field Marshal Montgomery has been labeled as one of the most daring plans in the entirety of the Second World War. The plan called for use of some 34,600 Allied airborne infantry, the Market, to provide the blanket for armored forces, the Garden, to roll forward on as they advanced into Germany in what is known as the largest airborne battle in history. The First Allied Airborne Army under tactical command by General Browning was composed of British, American, and Polish troops who would be dropped ahead of the land based armored advance of British XXX Corps to secure key bridges along a route known as the Corridor through the Netherlands to the Rhine. General Brian Horrocks, the commander of XXX Corps likened the operation to threading a series of needles as each bridge is secured and passed with the last bridge being the most essential to it’s success. This last bridge was Arnhem and was tasked to the British 1st Airborne Division to hold for an estimated 48 hours till XXX Corps could link up with them. This was an operation that was more dependent on fortune than the men partaking it could imagine.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warring States: Wargames Rules and Army Lists for the Warring States Era of Ancient China, 400-200 BC
Description: Wargames rules for Ancient China, 400-200 BC
Families: History: Warring States Period of China

Name: A Corner of Hell Supplement: Platoon Organisations & Additional Rules for World War II Skirmish Gaming
Description:
A Corner of Hell Supplement: Platoon Organisations & Additional Rules for World War II Skirmish Gaming

36 platoon organisations to the popular A Corner of Hell, the WW2 Skirmish miniature rules.

Name: By the Sword: Rules for Medieval & Renaissance Skirmish Gaming c400 to 1600AD
Description: By the Sword are Miniature Wargame skirmish rules for the Medieval and Renaissance period 400 - 1600 for 25/28mm minis.

Name: War in El Dorado: Warfare in the New World c1492 to 1550 – A Campaign Supplement for By the Sword
Description:
War in El Dorado

A set of skirmish rules to simulate warfare in the New World.
Supplement to By The Sword from the same author.

Name: Empire of the Steppes: Fast Play Wargame Rules for the Era of the Great Mongol Conquests 1206-1299 AD
Description:
Fast play wargame rules for the era of the great Mongol conquests, 1206-1299 AD.

Includes 31 army lists.

Name: Das Turnier oder Ritter-Spiel
Description:
This is a dice-rolling gambling game published in Vienna in the early 1800s.

Around a central scene of knights jousting are 20 illustrated squares each with one of the possible combinations of two dice. The double six appears in the middle image. Most of the squares show pieces of a knight's equipment, while the rest have various animals or objects as well as a wizard (3-3).

The rules say that all players should start by putting 24 Marks into the pot(the middle of the board). Players take turns rolling and must follow the instructions for the space showing their die roll. These either allow the player to take that amount from the pot or pay that much into the pot.

The first player to roll a double six takes the whole pot and ends the game. If there is nothing left in the pot when a double six is rolled, all players have to throw in half the original bet, which goes to the winner.

—user summary

Name: Day of Eagles: A Game of Aerial Combat in WW2
Description: Day of Eagles is a set of simple Miniature Wargame Rules to simulate aerial combat in WW2.

Name: Battle at Forests Edge
Description:
INTRODUCTION:
In the early dawn, two factions find themselves in dispute near a pristine green forest.  Can you eliminate your opponent’s commanders on your path to victory?

DESCRIPTION:
Battle at Forests Edge is a head-to-head card and dice game where players have to balance luck with tactical play.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Defeat all of the opposing player's command trucks.

GAME PLAY:
Players will place out their unit cards in descending rows of units to create a battlefield layout.  During each turn, players have a certain number of action points (AP) to spend to move, or attack with units.  Attacks are made with d8 dice to determine their effect.

GAME ELEMENTS:

Dice-rolling of multiple d8 dice to determine outcomes
    Unit placement and unit ranges
    Attack and defense effects between different unit types

—description from the designer

Name: Shenandoah: A Civil War Miniatures Campaign System – The Peninsular Module
Description:
A Shenandoah American Civil war Miniatures Campaign System for the James river Campaign.

The Penisula Campaign Module if the first follow up to Shenandoah. The basic system is mostly unchanged. What this module offers is a new map and vehicle to give meaningful strategic reasons for your ACW miniatures battles..

Map system for running the campaign using any rules set.

Name: Armies in Crisis: A Game of Combined Arms Combat in World War Two
Description:
Armies in Crisis is a set of miniature wargame rules to simulate combined arms combat during WWII.

It is  based on Contemptible Little Armies rules for WWI.

Name: 'Floating Castles': Fast-Play Rules for Naval Warfare in the Ironclad Era, c. 1860-1885
Description:
Floating Castles are miniature wargame rules to simulate naval warfare during the 1860-1885 period.

The rules cater for any scale with distances measured in yards and speed in knots, converted into inches or fractions.

You'll need D10's as the rules are based around percentage rolls for most outcomes.

The sequence of play is straightforward and is based on alternate moves, with each player moving one ship at a time based on an initiative roll. Shooting is simultaneous but torpedoes and ram attacks have their own placing in the sequence.

There are rules for weather and stability, with a die roll at the start of the game to determine the conditions of play.

Movement is measured in inches, with variable maneuverability depending upon the speed and size of ships involved.

Shooting is determined after movement has taken place. All shooting depends upon arcs of fire although, once again, there are no templates provided. If a target is in range and inside a firing arc at the end of the movement phase, it can be fired upon.

To hit a target, a D10 is rolled for each gun requiring a base 'to hit' score depending upon range. There are, in a addition, a small number of +1 modifiers for sea state, angle of fire etc.

If a hit is scored, a percentile roll is made to detemine damage, with various hit locations and effects. Armour penetration is dealt with by averaging out the actual armour protection of a target across the whole ship, with each vessel classified as either light, medium, heavy or super heavy. Armour penetration depends upon a D10 roll based on the weapon fired and the strength of the armour, modified by range.

There are additional straightforward rules for spar, locomotive and towed torpeodoes, mines, ramming and boarding. These are dealt with after the movement and shooting phases have been resolved.

At the end of the rulebook there are 13 comprehensive page of data tables for virtually every fleet that you might wish to deploy, with stats for both minor nations and the major powers. There are also details of the formulae used to calculate the stats for each ship, so you can always fill in the blanks for those vessels that aren't listed.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Huns in the Sun: A Game of Aerial Combat in World War I, 1915 to 1918
Description: Huns in the Sun are miniature wargame rules to simulate aerial combat in the First World War.

Name: Cold War Hotshots: A Game of Aerial Combat in the Jet Age, c. 1950-1967
Description: Cold War Hotshots is an attempt to produce a fast and enjoyable game of aerial combat which can be played out on an ordinary tabletop. This set covers both real and hypothectical conflicts set in the period between the outbreak of the Korean War and the Six Day War in the Middle East.

Name: Hexpionage
Description:
Hexpionage is an approachable yet intense two-player strategy board game that plays in under an hour. Deploy Agents, gather Intel, and sabotage opponents in this game of tension, strategy, and luck. Hexpionage combines hexagons with the thrill of espionage to create a satisfying abstract strategy game to feud over.

Hexpionage is easy to learn but difficult to master. You can learn the 3 pages of rules in less than 10 minutes, but with endless combinations of agents and board that never stops evolving, it offers a surprising depth of strategy.

The goal of the game is to acquire intel but you'll have to strike a careful balance as intel can also be used to activate the different agent's special abilities. You'll also have to watch out for Honeypots and other dangers as the board changes from turn to turn.

Name: Curious Humans
Description:
Curious Humans is a revealing icebreaker card game for people who don’t like small talk.  The rules are simple; correctly guess if the statements made by your opponents are either true or false – but watch out for the twists!

If half or more of the other players guess wrong, you win the card! First to 7 wins the game.

Features:


     Choose from 340 conversation starting statements across four different categories
     Each category is colour coded to help you to customise your game-play experience
     Twist up your game-play with over 40 twist cards


Curious Humans is a super simple game that is easy to learn, loads of fun and a great way to really get to know your fellow humans!

—description from the designer

Name: Cercado por Mortos
Description: Surrounded by the Dead (Cercado por Mortos) is a game-book - a book in which you are the main character, making decisions that can lead to a happy ending or major failures.  A pencil, paper and a 6-sided die is all you need to venture into a world that is both realistic and fantastic - as if a zombie epidemic were to occur the next night, as if the first zombies were the animated bodies of your neighbors  next to…

Name: タブーコード：ブルー (Taboo Code: Blue)
Description:
In Taboo Code: Blue (ã‚¿ãƒ–ãƒ¼ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ï¼šãƒ–ãƒ«ãƒ¼), each player has a card placed in front of them that can be seen by all the other players. (Each card has two words or phrases on it on opposite ends of the card, and whichever end is up is what's important.) The word or phrase in front of you is your taboo code.

Everyone then starts talking, with you trying to lure the other players into saying what is taboo for them. If they say their taboo code, then they're out of the round.

Name: Clash of Sabres: Tabletop Wargaming Rules for Aerial Combat 1948-1970
Description:
Clash of Sabres

Miniature wargame rules simulating post WW2 aerial combat.

Written by two ex-pilots, explore dog fighting in the early jet-age.  
Later piston aircraft are included too for some very interesting scenarios….

Name: East of Suez: Moderate Level Rules for Modern and Middle Eastern Wargaming (1950 to 1970)
Description:
East of Suez

Designed for Post War to circa 1980. 
These rules were primarily written to cover Britains’ retreat from Empire and the various Middle East Wars.'

Intended for skirmish level actions, a platoon of infantry and a tank troop plus supports will give a good game over an hour or two.

Name: F.E.B.A.+: Forward Edge of the Battle Area – Skirmish to Company Level Rules for Modern Land Wargaming (1970 to Present Date)
Description:
F.E.B.A.: Forward Edge of the Battle Area
The basic rules are almost repeats for EoS, set for skirmish level, though the weaponry can be a lot more exotic.

The upgrade set (hence the ‘+’ after FEBA) are set for Company or, for multi-player and a day, battalion level games.  They are easy to use, fast and fun and as close to realistic as we can get in a wargame.

The complexity comes more from the weaponry of the modern era – tandem warheads, composite armours and add-on armour blocks.  At higher command levels, these tend to fade away and a vehicle is either dead, or not.

The rules were extensively play-tested by the-then members of the Army Wargames Association, many of whom were veterans of Northern Ireland and First Gulf war, so, it should be pretty accurate!

—description from the publisher

Name: Animal Realms
Description:
Animal Realms is a card game that is played over 5 rounds and whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

At the start of each round, every player draws randomly seven animal cards. Each player chooses one of their cards as their goal card that shows how many animals they have to catch during a round to score points. The person who resembles an animal the most becomes the starting player.
In a player's turn they have to put one card from their hand face-up in front of them. Each of the seven different animal card has a different card effect so players need to use the cards in their hand cleverly to catch animals of other players or interfere with them. 
As an example the tiger can catch all the sheep that has been played before it or if 3 players in a row play a mouse they all get to keep the mouse they've played face down in front of them.
Each animal card has also a point value that is checked during scoring.

Name: Tut-Tut or A Run in a Motor Car
Description:
This is a British set collection card game. It has a deck of 48 cards, divided into sets of four cards, each naming a British city.

There also is a spinner built into the bottom of the box. Eight segments of the spinner indicate points gained between 0 and 60. The other four segments have losses of between 2 and 20. Printed on the bottom are a matching 12 segments, one per city in the deck.

To play, the deck is reduced to one set per player. The cards are then shuffled and dealt out evenly. Before play begins, the dealer without looking spins a dial fixed into the box and closes the lid.

Play then proceeds as in Pit. Players call out any number of cards they wish to exchange. They may not name or hint at cities they have or want. As soon as one player collects a set of four, he announces "Tut-Tut". The box is then opened to reveal how many points plus or minus that city is worth to the winner of this round.

Play continues until one player reaches a point total that varies by number of players, from 300 for four players to 100 for 11 to 12 players.

Each card bears the same photograph of four people in a car that resembles a 1905 Packard N. That and the mechanism suggests that it was published soon after Pit became a hit in the United States in 1903-04.

—user summary

Name: Hadara: The Plague Doctors
Description:
With Hadara: The Plague Doctors, each player gets access to two doctors who bring things both good and bad to your world.

After the "carving of a statue" action in phase A, you can choose to take the doctor of the matching Epoch, I or II, and place it on a color of your choice on your game board, regardless of whether you have cards of that color or not. For the remainder of the game, you cannot add cards of the plague-stricken color to your board. The plague doctor in Epoch I is worth 12 VP, while the one in Epoch II is worth 8 VP on its own or 13 VP if you have both doctors.

Name: Game of Cities
Description:
This is a question and answer card game about cities around the world. The deck includes 100 cards, and each card has 6 questions with that card's city as the answer. Each card also shows the date the city was founded and its population as of 1889. Former cities like Sparta, Troy and Pompeii have no population shown.

When used as an education aid, the teacher may draw cards, ask a question and award it to the player first able to answer correctly. Cards may also be distributed, with players taking turns asking a question: they either give it to the other player answering correctly, or keep it if no other player can answer. In either case, the player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

—user summary

Name: Third Lebanon War
Description:
"Third Lebanon War" is an operational level wargame on a hypothetical invasion of southern Lebanon by the Israeli Defence Forces some time in the near future. 
The context is that Israel has decided to mount an invasion of southern Lebanon to eliminate the threat posed by the continued presence and actions of the Hezbollah organization, but on a much larger and more destructive scale than the 2006 incursion.

One player (the IDF) takes the role of the commander of the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF); 
the other (the Insurgent) the role of the commander of the Hezbollah irregular forces. 
The Insurgent player may also receive units from other countries (Syria or Iran) if certain events occur to cause them to enter the game (players may also agree to have these additional forces in the mix from the beginning of the game, or not to include them at all).

—description from introduction
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Sepoy: Wargame Rules for the Indian Mutiny
Description:
Based on the English Civil War rules File Leader, by Pete Berry, the action is based around the company which is represented by six figures for infantry and three for cavalry. Due to the command and control system, Sepoy is an ideal multi-player game as one player can represent the mutineers and the other player or players will have officer figures representing them and their command and control on the tabletop battlefield.

A 44 page book plus 4 page card playsheet.

Name: Lobbyist: Shaping the Vote
Description:
In the world of politics it seems nothing is every completely clear and many c operations work hard and spends millions to see that their interests are put before all others. In the game of Lobbyist - Shaping the Vote, players get to try their hand at lobbying, working to influence politicians to vote their desired way while competing with other lobbyist who are working towards a different means and outcome.

Lobbyist - Shaping the Vote is a game where players take on the role of Lobbyist trying to influence the political committee to voting in their desired way. Each player is a lobbyist starting with $50,000. The board is a political committee voting on five issues, Education, Health and Welfare, Infrastructure, Taxes and Revenue, Crime and Punishment. Each issue's influence is represented by a dice value and Lobbyist play cards from their hand to increase and decrease those dice values. Around the board will be 5,7,or 9 (depending on difficulty of play) unique politicians, all with a voting position value for each of the five issues. Politicians will not vote yes until the die values matches or exceeds their voting position values. Each lobbyist it working to gather desired votes on these issues, wanting to gather yes votes on two issues, and no votes on two issues, being indifferent on the fifth issue (each player lobbyist card has different yes/no goals on their cards).

Throughout the game players will have cards in hand and will draw and play a card on their turn. Most cards will allow then to influence one or more of the voting issue dice. Vote cards are shuffled into the deck and when one of these is drawn the player immediately plays the Vote card and the committee votes on the issues. Prior to voting though the Lobbyist all have one final chance to influence their politicians by either taking a vote action (indicted on the cards), or by spending up to $20,000 of their money to increase or decrease dice values. Once each player has had a chance to take or pass on an action, the politicians vote on the issues and players get yes/no vote tokens for their successful lobbying. Game ends after the fifth vote happens and final scores are tallied.

I came up with this game idea after sitting through a number of political action committee meetings and hearing the same info numerous times, so I started jotting ideas. The can has been play tested some and everyone I have played with has enjoyed the game at this point.

—description from the designer

Name: Battle of North Kursk
Description:
The Battle of North Kursk is always a focus point of both history and military enthusiasts. This game concentrates on the battle of the Northern pincer between Model's 9th army and 2nd panzer army and Rokossovski's Central Front from July 5, 1943 to August 4, 1943. It covers the attack by 9th Army south towards Kursk and the counterattack from the East by the 3rd, 63rd Soviet armies and 3rd Guard tank army against Mzensk. Each turn represents 4 days. The game system is similar to Storm over Stalingrad. Card driven game with area movements.

—description from the publisher

Name: Die Höhle der Löwen
Description:
The board game for the German TV show

We are looking for the best innovators and investors - because projects not only have to be assessed, they also have to be sold well! Alternately, the players take on the roles of the candidates and the lions. If it is your turn as a candidate, introduce one of the 50 included projects and try to convince the lions of your business idea. He also has a secret mission to perform that can earn him a bonus. Special events make every deal unique. As soon as the project has been presented, it is the lions' turn.

As in the show, there is now a lot of discussion and haggling, because everyone wants to make the best deals. While the lions want to win as many shares as possible, the candidate is careful to the contrary. Once all the lions have submitted their offers or have spoken the magic words "I'm out!", The candidate has to choose one of the offers or reject all. Now it becomes clear whether the project has been successful. so the shares he gets will decide the winning and the losing. If the candidate has given too many shares, he can also make losses! As soon as each player has the role of the candidate, the game ends and the player with the most money wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Tiger, Tiger, Burning Bright
Description:
Tiger, Tiger, Burning Bright is a set of miniature wargame rules for World War Two, designed for 1/200th.

25 pages plus 16-page reference section.

Name: Magic Maze: Technische Anlagen
Description:
This mini/promo expansion for Magic Maze consists of tiles G, H, and I of Magic Maze: 9 new tiles

The base game and the expansion "Maximum security" are necessary to use the new tiles.

Name: Once Upon a Time...In the West Country
Description:
Once Upon a Time...In the West Country

Simple skirmish rules for the English Civil War (1640-1660). Troops are raw, trained, or veteran, and have a few skills (such as fire-combat experts, etc.). Cavalry, infantry, and artillery are catered for. Includes 2 scenarios.

There is no fixed time or ground scale. Designed for 1 figure = 1 man, using 25mm figures.

The rules suggest no more than 6 figures per player.

—description from the publisher

Name: English Civil War Sieges: Rules & Scenarios for Wargamers
Description:
English Civil War Sieges
An extensive guide to running ECW siege scenarios, for any ECW miniatures system.

Covering all aspects of siege warfare, including - siege equipment (such as fire-pikes, petards, heated shot & siege engines), obstacles (such as faggots, gabions & gulay gorod) and the structure and design features used in fortifications, as well as the means employed by attackers to counter them.

5 siege specific scenarios:

     The Attack on the South Gate, Gloucester 1643
     Treachery at Windsor, 1642
     The Storming of Chester, 1645/1646
     The Storming of Bristol, 1643
     Basing House, 1645


—description from the publisher

Name: Chevauchée: 100 Years War Medieval Rules
Description:
Medieval Miniature Wargame Rules.

14 Pages + Card Play Sheet

Name: Lord of the Fries: Long Wok on Short Pier Chinese Restaurant
Description:
This is a stand-alone expansion for Lord of the Fries, set at Friedey's Long Wok Chinese restaurant. The deck contains all new art and ingredients, with a new menu for 2 to 6 players, and instructions for combining the deck with the core game to create a deck that plays with up to 8 players.

The menu's special rule is: When you fill an order, you may steal one ingredient from anywhere on the table, as long as you play at least two from your hand.

Name: Lord of the Fries: Ghicciaroni's Family Style Italian Buffet
Description:
This is a stand-alone expansion for Lord of the Fries, set at Ghicciaroni's Italian restaurant. The deck contains all new art and ingredients, with a new menu for 2 to 6 players, and instructions for combining the deck with the core game to create a deck that plays with up to 8 players.

The menu's special rule is: Any order from the red zones (pizza and pasta) starts at minus 1 ingredient, which means you may immediately leave something out.

Name: Curious Humans: Kinky Humans Expansion Pack
Description:
Delve into your friends’ deepest fantasies and discover new ones with the Kinky expansion for Curious Humans.

Introducing the new CHOOSE feature these cards are not for the faint of heart.

Contains 50 kinky statements cards.

Name: Curious Humans: Morbid Humans Expansion Pack
Description:
Curious about the morbid and macabre?

Explore these dark themes with the Morbid expansion for Curious Humans.

WARNING: The Morbid expansion contains confronting topics such as death, suicide, torture and other morbid themes. Please use caution when purchasing this product.

Contains 50 morbid statement cards.

Name: Curious Humans: Deviant Humans Expansion Pack
Description:
Expose your friends’ wicked thoughts about each other with the Deviant expansion for Curious Humans.

Warning: Deviant Humans contains sexual references about the other humans playing.  Ensure all players are aware of these cards before beginning the game.

Contains 50 deviant statement cards
